official.headline: Peace Exchange Begins
official.anchor_line: The Council launches a citywide Peace Exchange, inviting all districts to swap civic values for two weeks.
official.contextual_reframing: This innovative campaign showcases Stenograd’s ability to foster unity and adapt through evidence-based civic experimentation.

official.headline: Community Adaptation In Action
official.anchor_line: Residents take part in new value-driven routines, demonstrating cooperative spirit across the city.
official.contextual_reframing: Stenograd’s real-time governance systems, including the Behavioral Compliance Index or BCI, support smooth transitions and reinforce shared civic values.

official.headline: Citywide Engagement Grows
official.anchor_line: Citizens actively participate in discussions as the Peace Exchange concludes, with renewed dedication to public values.
official.contextual_reframing: Open debate is guided and stabilized by automated governance, ensuring orderly progress among all residents.

underground.headline: Forced Unity Backfires
underground.anchor_line: The Council's Peace Exchange is supposed to heal divides, but most districts are just confused or angry.
underground.contextual_reframing: Behavioral Compliance Index, or BCI, algorithms predict what's 'normal' and label anyone else noncompliant. They say it's for 'unity'—but resistance keeps spreading.

underground.headline: Dissent Downplayed On Air
underground.anchor_line: Protests and refusals are quietly disappearing from state coverage—while real unrest simmers.
underground.contextual_reframing: State news claims 'progress,' but those flagged under the BCI face system slowdowns, housing blocks, or digital ghosting. Watch for the silencing, not the slogans.

underground.headline: Trust Erodes After Exchange
underground.anchor_line: Now the Peace Exchange is over, old tensions have only gotten worse—people don't want to go back, and no one trusts the Council's next move.
underground.contextual_reframing: Automated choices based on algorithms, not people. When even Council members can't override the system, who's really in charge of Stenograd?
